intro: Aellenia sistanica, commonly known as the Sistan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in dry, sandy soils. Aellenia sistanica is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability.
